DataElement.preferredName: Liver Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Distant Metastasis M Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for the hepatocellular carcinoma based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to clinical evaluated M stage of a large organ located in the upper abdomen that cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile (the liver).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 12/19/18 TT received CTEP permission/BC to transfer DEC ownership to NCI Standards.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Liver Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical M Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of liver cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Liver Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Liver Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Liver cancer with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Liver Cancer cM1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Liver cancer with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Liver Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Liver Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Liver cancer without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Liver Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Liver cancer without evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of liver cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.:A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.longName: Liver Cancer Clinical Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of liver cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
